#Text=Watson Lake
#Text=Watson Lake is a town of 800 people ( 2016 ) in southeastern Yukon , close to the British Columbia border .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Watson Lake is near the Liard River , at the junction of the Robert Campbell Highway and the Alaska Highway .
#Text=The Cassiar Highway 's northern end is 22 km(14 miles ) west of Watson Lake .

#Text=Watson Lake is the main centre of the small forestry industry in Yukon and has been a service centre for the mining industry , especially for the Cassiar asbestos mine in northern British Columbia and the Cantung tungsten mine on the Yukon-Northwest Territories border in the Mackenzie Mountains .
#Text=Watson Lake and the neighbouring Upper Liard settlement are the home of the Liard River First Nation , a member of the Kaska Dena Council .
#Text=The Two Mile area immediately north of the core of town is a concentrated area of First Nations residents , while the town extends 8 km out to the turn-off of Airport Road .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Like most of Yukon , Watson Lake has a subarctic climate .
#Text=Watson Lake experiences annual temperature average daily highs of 21 ° C ( 69.8 ° F ) in July and average daily lows of −27 ° C ( −16.6 ° F ) in January .

#Text=Watson Lake has more precipitation than other parts of Yukon with an average annual snowfall of 197 cm ( 77.6 inches ) and 255 mm ( 10.04 inches ) of rainfall , resulting in larger trees and a more viable forest industry .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Alaska highway ( historical mile 635 ) from Fort Nelson or Whitehorse .
#Text=The Watson Lake Airport provides corporate and charter services only .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Local taxi services are available .
#Text=See
#Text=Signpost Forest , At the intersection of the Alaska and Robert Campbell Highways .
#Text=In 1942 , a homesick U.S. Army G.I. working on the Alaska Highway posted a sign with the name and distance of his home town .
#Text=The tradition has continued and by the end of 2017 , now the signpost forest had accumulated over 80,000 signs .
#Text=Do
#Text=Northern Lights Centre , On the Alaska Highway in Watson Lake , ☏ +1867 536-7827 , ✉ nlc@yknet.ca .
#Text=If you ca n't see them outside , see them inside .
#Text=This centre features a northern lights multimedia presentation in a 100-seat theatre .
#Text=It also features other interactive displays discussing the science and folklore behind the northern lights .
#Text=Open during the summer season only .
#Text=In the winter , the centre is used for community events , movies , and space science education .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Wolf It Down Restaurant , Mile 650 , Alaska Highway ( 23 km west of Watson Lake ) , ☏ +1867 536-2307 .
#Text=Bakery and home-style meals , at Nugget City .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Andrea 's ( old Belvedere ) , ☏ +1 867-536-7712 .
#Text=Hotel , Bar and restaurant
#Text=Truck stop , tire repair , mechanic and restaurant
#Text=Kathy 's Kitchen , ☏ +1 867-536-2400 .
#Text=Restaurant
#Text=Restaurant
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Downtown RV Park , 105 8 St N , ☏ +1867 536-2646 .
#Text=Cozy Nest Hideaway , 1175 Campbell Hwy ( 10 minutes ( 8 km ) from town on the #4 Hwy ) , ☏ +1867 536-2204 .
#Text=A beautiful and friendly bed and breakfast on the lake .
#Text=Open year round .
#Text=No pets , no smoking indoors .
#Text=$ 100 single , $ 110 couple in the house ; in the summer a cabin is available for $ 90 single , $ 100 couple .
#Text=Andrea 's Hotel , 609 Frank Trail , ☏ +1867 536-7712 .
#Text=2 Queen size beds/ all non smoking , not pet friendly .
#Text=Restaurant and lounge also available .
#Text=Satellite TV , wireless internet/wifi .
#Text=Open year round .
#Text=Dragon 's Den Hotel/Motel , on the Alaska Highway , ☏ +1867 536-7115 .
#Text=2 queen size bed , non-smoking and smoking rooms , pet-free and pet-friendly rooms , Chinese restaurant and lounge opening soon .
#Text=Satellite TV , wi-fi , kitchenettes , open all year round .
#Text=Air Force Lodge , 136 Adela Trail , Watson Lake , ☏ +1867 536-2890 , ✉ airforcelodge@yahoo.ca .
#Text=Open May-Sep .
#Text=It is the oldest building in Watson Lake .
#Text=It was built at the Watson Lake Airport 1942 as a barracks for the pilots flying during Second World War , and was later moved to the town .
#Text=$ 89 single , $ 99 double .
#Text=Nugget City , Mile 650 , Alaska Highway ( 23 km west of Watson Lake ) , ☏ +1867 536-2307 .
#Text=RV park , cottages , and tenting area .
#Text=Restaurant , gift shop , and vehicle service centre on-site .
#Text=Laundromat , RV wash , available Wi-Fi connection , Roger ’s repair service nearby offers tire repairs .
#Text=Most sites have large pull-throughs which allow any size vehicle with tow car .
#Text=Sites are mostly 30 amp , but there are a few 50 amp sites .
#Text=Each unit has water and electricity .
#Text=There is a sani-dump on-site .
#Text=Pets welcome , on leash only .
#Text=Stampeder 's B&B Cabins , 606 Adela Trail , ☏ +1867 536-2157 .
#Text=2 beautiful fully loaded cabins , wireless internet , satellite TV , open year round .
#Text=Single or double $ 140 , triple $ 160 .
#Text=A Nice Motel , 705 Frank Trail ( downtown ) , ☏ +1867 536-7222 .
#Text=10 rooms with 1 queen bed , kitchenettes , wired internet , satellite T.V. fireplace .
#Text=$150/night .
#Text=Big Horn Hotel , Frank Trail ( downtown ) , ☏ +1 867-536-2020 .
#Text=Jacuzzi room , kitchenettes , single/double rooms , satellite TV , wireless internet .
#Text=Open year round .
#Text=Connect
#Text=Finding a pay phone should not be a problem in Watson Lake .
#Text=If all else fails , there is one just inside Super A Foods and inside Andrea 's Hotel , along the Alaska Highway .
#Text=Watson Lake Community Library , 701 Adela Trail ( Town of Watson Lake Administration Building ) , ☏ +1867 536-7517 , ✉ wllib@klondiker.com .
#Text=Provides free public Internet and computer access .
#Text=Go next
#Text=You 've probably encountered Watson Lake while traveling along the Alaska Highway .

#Text=Heading north 264km towards Whitehorse , you will find Teslin with beautiful scenery and a good photo opportunity as you approach the Teslin River Bridge ( second longest bridge along the Alaska Highway ) .
#Text=Heading south 210km towards Fort Nelson , stop for a relaxing sit in the natural Liard River Hot Springs ( open year round ) .
